question: https://www.quora.com/Could-the-story-of-advanced-technology-in-ramayana-and-mahabharata-be-true

Answer: One can never say for sure if they possessed the technology that's detailed in the epics, with what little research we've done on it. We have to keep in mind that these are stories based on events that may or may not have happened centuries ago. And when stories are retold by another person, they tend to add details of their own in it. That's why the different versions of the Ramayana have vast differences among them.There is no doubt that India was the land of ideas and innovation from the beginning of mankind. We were the most advanced civilization of the time, and have made huge contributOne can never say for sure if they possessed the technology that's detailed in the epics, with what little research we've done on it. We have to keep in mind that these are stories based on events that may or may not have happened centuries ago. And when stories are retold by another person, they tend to add details of their own in it. That's why the different versions of the Ramayana have vast differences among them.There is no doubt that India was the land of ideas and innovation from the beginning of mankind. We were the most advanced civilization of the time, and have made huge contributions to even modern science. But does that mean we were able to fly planes and build nuclear weapons at a time when people had to walk to move from one place to another? If they possessed that kind of technology, why didn't they build anything that could improve the quality of life of the people and focused solely on military research? It's just extremely hard to believe.I'm not saying all those stories are made up. There is a chance that the early Indian civilization could have been the most advanced society till date. But without actual solid evidence, there is no way of knowing for sure. And the amount of research that has gone into these epics are definitely not enough. I am certainly proud of my heritage, for what they've accomplished with what little they had, even if they did or didn't make a vimana. But when we boast that our people made planes and weapons of mass destruction at a time when they didn't have the knowledge of electricity or fossil fuels, the rest of the world might just take us less seriously. And our actual contributions that made a difference to modern science and technology are drowned in all the noise.

Answer: In my opinion, by far was Citroen DS.When it appeared in 1955 (imagine France in reconstruction mode after WWII devastation) my father use to say that looked like an “UFO” compared with any other car available. It was even modern 12 years later in 1967.The degree of innovation was simply stunning:-Aerodynamics-It was the first production car equipped with disc brakes, inboard disk brakes (not in the wheels) to reduce unsprung weight-Fibreglass roof which lowered the center of gravity and so reduced weight transfer-1st ever car with hydro-pneumatic suspension, including an automatic leveling syIn my opinion, by far was Citroen DS.When it appeared in 1955 (imagine France in reconstruction mode after WWII devastation) my father use to say that looked like an “UFO” compared with any other car available. It was even modern 12 years later in 1967.The degree of innovation was simply stunning:-Aerodynamics-It was the first production car equipped with disc brakes, inboard disk brakes (not in the wheels) to reduce unsprung weight-Fibreglass roof which lowered the center of gravity and so reduced weight transfer-1st ever car with hydro-pneumatic suspension, including an automatic leveling system and variable ground clearance-In addition, the vehicle had power steering and a semi-automatic transmission-Different front and rear track widths and tire sizes reduced the unequal tire loadingSet new standards in ride quality, handling, and braking.The DS placed third in the 1999 Car of the Century competition, and fifth on Automobile Magazine's "100 Coolest Cars". It was also named the most beautiful car of all time by Classic & Sports Car magazine after a poll of 20 world-renowned car designers, including Giorgetto Giugiaro, Ian Callum, Roy Axe, Paul Bracq, and Leonardo Fioravanti.I think it was by far, the most advanced car designed ever, ahead of its time

This invention could remove language barriers and make travelling - and doing business with other cultures – much easier. With these earbuds, someone could be standing in front of you speaking French, and the earbuds will feed you the English translation. You can then hold down your right earbud and speak in English, and your phone will project the French translation from the Pixel's speaker, so the other person can hear. The earbuds can translate 40 different languages!

Answer: Some inventions have been recognized as catalysts for great civilizations. The video below introduces 4 inventions that have helped change our world. They include paper-making, gunpowder, printing, and the compass.But just a few days ago, I came across an invention I didn't think existed. Its technology proves there are other worlds around us.I want to talk about the spooky spirit radio invented by Nicola Tesla.This scientist successfully developed some wireless communication technologies, and one of the most famous devices he invented is a radio that can recSome inventions have been recognized as catalysts for great civilizations. The video below introduces 4 inventions that have helped change our world. They include paper-making, gunpowder, printing, and the compass.But just a few days ago, I came across an invention I didn't think existed. Its technology proves there are other worlds around us.I want to talk about the spooky spirit radio invented by Nicola Tesla.This scientist successfully developed some wireless communication technologies, and one of the most famous devices he invented is a radio that can receive voices from the spiritual world.Tesla completed the prototype of this radio as early as 1901. The machine does not require auxiliary power to generate electricity.At the time, Tesla just wanted to create a device that received radio waves. However, he detected some scary and eerie sounds during the test.When studying the radio in the lab, Tesla heard some noise at first, like several people were talking. When he listened carefully to the background sounds, he found the conversations were not of this world.There was a shrill sound of whining, crying, and iron chains. He intuitively thought that was the sound from hell. Then the radio picked up another voice. It was very low. It was not a human voice, but the voice of a demon in hell talking.After the incident, Tesla put the experiments on hold to move to other ones.In 1918, he resumed his project on the spooky radio. He made some changes to the antenna to enhance the reception quality. This time, the radio picked up a very long noise. Tesla heard many people crying and wailing, both men and women, young and old. But he couldn't understand what was being said though he had heard many languages. He believed that these deep voices were not languages that humans could utter.The longer he listened, the clearer these voices became. His entire laboratory was filled with weeping and the low voices of unknown creatures.Though Tesla had superhuman knowledge at that time, he could not know the source of these voices, and could only guess that they came from hell.Besides the sound of ghosts, his radio could also pick up a signal from the mysterious object "Black Knight" orbiting the Earth.This spirit radio also shows abilities of detecting lightning, making voice phenomena, interacting with all forms of light, creating music and sound effects, and reading a computer screen.

chips, and nuclear power, and canned food, and drones, and aviation technology, and GPS, and infant formula, and indexing of websites for search engines, and bar codes, and touch screens, and vaccines, and windpower, and the accelerometer, and fire resistant clothing, and aerodynamic trucks, airbags, miniature cameras that fit in a webcam or cellphone, weather forecasting, and submarines, cellular technologWell, let’s think about it for a bit.What kind of technologies have been invented in the last century?We have things like radar, and microwave, and the internet, and satellites and computer chips, and nuclear power, and canned food, and drones, and aviation technology, and GPS, and infant formula, and indexing of websites for search engines, and bar codes, and touch screens, and vaccines, and windpower, and the accelerometer, and fire resistant clothing, and aerodynamic trucks, airbags, miniature cameras that fit in a webcam or cellphone, weather forecasting, and submarines, cellular technology and networks, RAM memory, hard disk drives, liquid-crystal displays, lithium batteries, so on.But all that kind of stuff was developed by having governments getting involved, funding research and science and so on.Which, as we all know, is a really inefficient method, it pretty much doesn’t work.Instead of this inefficient method that clearly doesn’t work, of having governments take part in research and development, we now have a much better strategy for innovation:Random guys in their garage!As we all know, that’s where all the true innovation comes from, random middle class dudes, who have ideas, and then do a startup in their garage.Either that, or huge corporations who invest in ways to extend their patents.So now, we have much more groundbreaking innovation.We have things like Amazon, who patented and made a fortune off one-click buying, the truly revolutionary idea of not making people click more than needed.Do you really think that government could have ever come up with a brilliant idea like that, huh?

Answer: Powered exoskeletons…“I am ze Rhino!”Sure, powered exoskeletons look pretty damn cool. I won’t argue there. And yeah, they’re a hell of a lot better than fighting somebody without one.But, here’s the thing about powered exoskeletons: the person within the exoskeleton limits the exoskeleton’s capabilities. Suddenly, the exoskeleton has to account for a person’s heat tolerance, the types of forces a person can withstand, a person’s range of motion… It’s a mess.Wouldn’t it just be smarter to design a robot instead of an exoskeleton, and man it remotely? Not only would you be able to build a far sPowered exoskeletons…“I am ze Rhino!”Sure, powered exoskeletons look pretty damn cool. I won’t argue there. And yeah, they’re a hell of a lot better than fighting somebody without one.But, here’s the thing about powered exoskeletons: the person within the exoskeleton limits the exoskeleton’s capabilities. Suddenly, the exoskeleton has to account for a person’s heat tolerance, the types of forces a person can withstand, a person’s range of motion… It’s a mess.Wouldn’t it just be smarter to design a robot instead of an exoskeleton, and man it remotely? Not only would you be able to build a far stronger machine — you don’t have to account for human limitations — but you’ll also be able to keep its operatorThere’s a reason why the U.S military invests tons of money into drones and robots, and barely anything into powered exoskeletons.Sorry Tony Stark: your Iron Man suit makes no goddamn sense.
name: Abdullah Ijaz

Answer: The Cthulhu Mythos, by Howard Phillips Lovecraft (and other authors)You’ve probably seen this guy in many forms of pop culture:At first glance, he looks like a giant octopus-man-dragon but it would be more accurate to say he is an eldritch entity.The source of all human fear can be traced back to him, every time you are anxious or suddenly filled with dread for no apparent reason, it is just yourThe Cthulhu Mythos, by Howard Phillips Lovecraft (and other authors)You’ve probably seen this guy in many forms of pop culture:At first glance, he looks like a giant octopus-man-dragon but it would be more accurate to say he is an eldritch entity.The source of all human fear can be traced back to him, every time you are anxious or suddenly filled with dread for no apparent reason, it is just your subconscious being afraid of the thought of him awaking from his sleep.So what can this guy do exactly?Well he has the power to manipulate your dreams and make you see whatever he wants you to. Think about it, he could turn every human alive right now into batshit insane maniacs in just a night.He also has really good regenerative powers, you actually have to kill him physically, mentally and spiritually to ‘kill’ him, which is pretty much impossible.He also can manipulate dimensions, as his city, R’Lyeh, has geometry impossible to create in our three-dimensional universe.Just by looking at him, ANYONE will go crazy and lose their minds. They will become insane or kill themselves. So yeah, Thor, the Silver Surfer, Batman and even some forms of Superman will lose their shit just by looking at him.But I only started with Cthulhu as he is not in the top ten, not in the top twenty, and not even in the top one hundred most powerful entities in the Cthulhu Mythos. In fact he isn’t even in the top infinite most powerful beings in the Mythos.Introducing the ‘Lesser’ Outer Gods (The Ultimate Gods).They are to Cthulhu what Cthulhu is to a mere mortal man.They are above all concepts of time and space, and are above the notion of dimensions completely. One of the most powerful beings in the Marvel universe, the Beyonder (Pre-Retcon) is no match for even a single of these cosmic horrors as they are infinitely more powerful than him. As while the Beyonder still exists within an infinite amount of higher and lower dimensions, the Lesser Outer Gods are undimensioned, beyond the concept of even dimensions themselves.Now guess how many of these guys exist within the Mythos?4? Nope. Higher.10? Nope. Higher.100000000? Nope. Higher.10^9999999? Nope. Higher.There are an infinite amount of Lesser Outer Gods.But guess what? We are still a LONG way from the top of the food chain.Now we have us some Outer Gods:Nyarlathotep, The Crawling ChaosThis tentacled freak is your worst nightmare.He can freely traverse any and every plane of existence.He is the conceptual embodiment of evil. Literally.He can turn mortals into avatars of himself.Said avatars can make even the Ultimate Gods seem like cannon fodder in comparison. These Avatars only have a minuscule fraction of Nyarlathotep’s true might.He is also my favourite of the Outer Gods since he isn’t mindless and actually has sentience, even if he uses it pretty much to make everyone and everything’s life more miserable, even other Outer Gods.Shub-Niggurath, The Black Goat of the Woods with a Thousand Young“She is a perverse fertility deity, said to appear as an enormous cloudy mass which extrudes black tentacles, slime-dripping mouths, and short, writhing goat legs. Small creatures are continually spat forth by the monstrosity, which are either consumed into the miasmatic form or escape to some monstrous life elsewhere.”-The Last TestThis Outer God is literally a THOT.She is called the ‘all-mother’ since she has mated with many other Gods, meaning almost every one of them can trace their existence to her. This means she has an INFINITE amount of children. I really feel sorry to all the fathers who must pay child support.Actually now that I think about it, Shub-Niggurath is the grandmother of Cthulhu, and it is said that she mated with Hastur, a Great Old One like Cthulhu—the brother of Cthulhu, in fact.That’s just gross.And now we have the crème de la crème.Yog-Sothoth, The All-In-One“It was an All-in-One and One-in-All of limitless being and self—not merely a thing of one Space-Time continuum, but allied to the ultimate animating essence of existence's whole unbounded sweep—the last, utter sweep which has no confines and which outreaches fancy and mathematics alike. It was perhaps that which certain secret cults of earth have whispered of as YOG-SOTHOTH, and which has been a deity under other names; that which the crustaceans of Yuggoth worship as the Beyond-One, and which the vaporous brains of the spiral nebulae know by an untranslatable Sign—yet in a flash the Carter-facet realized how slight and fractional all these conceptions are.”-Through the gates of the silver keyThis is the most powerful God in the Cthulhu Mythos.H...
name: Alistair Ward

Answer: The Doctor. He can be considered an enemy faction, if you were intending on eradicating life on Earth or something like that. The Doctor is a force of nature that goes beyond space and time (Via the Tardis), has caused the eradication (and suspension in time) of his own race, AND has defeated The Cybermen (Beefed up Borg), The Dalek (Galactic xenophobes), a parasite the size of a star, Satan (Lucifer?) AND if he (Now a she) were to die, they would regenerate (Basically reincarnation right on the spot).Now, you might be thinking, “I know he’s coming, I can prepare.” You’d be wrong, many of hisThe Doctor. He can be considered an enemy faction, if you were intending on eradicating life on Earth or something like that. The Doctor is a force of nature that goes beyond space and time (Via the Tardis), has caused the eradication (and suspension in time) of his own race, AND has defeated The Cybermen (Beefed up Borg), The Dalek (Galactic xenophobes), a parasite the size of a star, Satan (Lucifer?) AND if he (Now a she) were to die, they would regenerate (Basically reincarnation right on the spot).Now, you might be thinking, “I know he’s coming, I can prepare.” You’d be wrong, many of his victories were against RACES who’ve planned and prepared for years. Remember, he’s beyond time and space.He can go back to a time before you decided to do your dirty deed, and, well I doubt he’d kill you. He has other ways of punishing people. Just ask the little girl he put in the mirror. Or her brother whom now sits over the fields of England as a scarecrow. Or her mother who was tossed into the event horizon of a collapsing galaxy, just so she can experience what it is to live forever.

Answer: Why do you specify that 40K is included? They’re not even close to the top.My suggestion is:A Type 91 WarTardisA regular Tardis is in of itself extremely powerful. The Doctor’s Tardis is old, worn out, constantly breaking down. It’s made for civilians and is severely outdated even by those standards. It still takes the energy of the Big Bang to get through its shell.This is a WarTardis. It’s to the Doctor’s Tardis what this:Is to this:The main offensive weapons include channeling the Eye of Harmony, its power source, into a blast capable of killing Chronovores.As the Masters WarTARDIS felt theWhy do you specify that 40K is included? They’re not even close to the top.My suggestion is:A Type 91 WarTardisA regular Tardis is in of itself extremely powerful. The Doctor’s Tardis is old, worn out, constantly breaking down. It’s made for civilians and is severely outdated even by those standards. It still takes the energy of the Big Bang to get through its shell.This is a WarTardis. It’s to the Doctor’s Tardis what this:Is to this:The main offensive weapons include channeling the Eye of Harmony, its power source, into a blast capable of killing Chronovores.As the Masters WarTARDIS felt the first warmth of the Eye's majesty, it's topology twisted once more, forming a five-dimensional lense that focused the unstoppable might that instantly flooded through the wormhole.An actinic spear arced out across both the space-time continuum and the time vortex - and hit the precise centre of the Chronovores' vicious flock.The reaction was immediate. A few Chronovores effectively evaporated under the onslaught, their polydimensional matrices shattering under the impact; many more were caught in the edges of the blast and left injured or dying, their once perfect bodies deformed and broken.Chronovores are beings made from six-dimensional matrices that can rewrite history and consume timelines, up to and including those of entire universes. And that WarTardis was slaughtering them. In the same book, two of them hold their own against the Quantum Archangel.It should have been unbeatable: omniscient, omnipotent. But the two TARDISes were holding their own. Both machines had been reworked again and again since their birth in the TARDIS cradles, with countless improvements from countless civilisations. And for the first time since they had both left those same cradles, they were on the same side. The Quantum Archangel was losing. The two TARDISes, fighting as one, broke through the sidereal barrier, knocking the Quantum Archangel away as if she were no more than an irritation, rearranging their apron wakes into whips and knives to keep her at bay. As she flailed in the vortex, a flaming figure in distress, the TARDISes reached the parallel universe of the Cla’tac’teth, found that race’s planet orbiting a dead neutron star orbiting a lifeless version of the Great Attractor... ...and passed back through the sidereal barrier to another Great Attractor, leaving the Quantum Archangel on the other side.She’s not exactly using her powers to their full potential, but this is still the being that created 7 billion universes at once.In addition it can loop, stop and speed up time in areas. In terms of pure destructive power, they can retroactively erase entire solar systems. The solar system it’s aimed at and anything in it simply never existed.In short, it’s a sentient universe covered in a shell that could take the universe collapsing in on it, with enough temporal firepower to erase solar systems from time and kill beings that eat universes as light snacks.And then there’s what happens if you destroy it improperly…If you disagree with any of the above or have anything to add, feel free to leave a comment.Edit:

Answer: The Andromeda strain fromInvestigation of the strain demonstrated that it was mutating rapidly; it suddenly developed the ability to de-poThe Andromeda strain fromInvestigation of the strain demonstrated that it was mutating rapidly; it suddenly developed the ability to de-polymerize plastics, causing an airplane to crash as all the plastic parts turned to dust. Furthermore, it had no proteins at all. It was a living thing without proteins. This is the biological equivalent of a star without hydrogen; it’s simply unheard-of.Two people survived in the town: a healthy baby who screamed all the time and an old drunk with an ulcer who took asprin by the handful and drank methanol. The novel is in part a medical detective story to find out why they survived when no one else did.It’s apparently still out there, mutating away.
